sentences.english: Her charm prejudiced the judges in her favour.
sentences.chinese: 她姿色迷人，因而评委都偏向她。

sentences.english: Purple, for example, represents unwanted touching.
sentences.chinese: 例如，姿色代表不想要的接触。

sentences.english: Being beautiful is such a power. You can get whatever you want.
sentences.chinese: 姿色就是力量，凭姿色你可以得你所想。

sentences.english: Being beautiful is such a power. You can get whatever you want.
sentences.chinese: 姿色就是力量，凭姿色你可以得你所想。

sentences.english: She is quite pretty, but unhealthy-looking.
sentences.chinese: 她颇有几分姿色，但看起来并不健康。

sentences.english: You're fond of turning on your charm.
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢用姿色影响别人。

sentences.english: Girls of that time did not readily show their feminine charm.
sentences.chinese: 那时候的女孩子，也不敢轻易暴露出自己的姿色。

sentences.english: The purple purse made of genuine leather for auction arouse our attention.
sentences.chinese: 那个待拍卖的真皮姿色钱包引起了我们的注意。

sentences.english: Although the woman's beauty, but also in essence, is a rare resource.
sentences.chinese: 虽然女人的姿色，也实质上是一种难得的资源。

definition: lit. countenance of a flower, face like the moon (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) beautiful
divine fragrance, national grace (idiom); an outstanding beauty
lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful/also written 傾城傾國|倾城倾国[qing1 cheng2 qing1 guo2]
middle-aged but still attractive woman/lady of a certain age
middle-aged but still attractive woman/lady of a certain age
lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful
